newsitem.title: GERMANY: No cargo fuel surcharge at DHL Germany.
newsitem.headline: No cargo fuel surcharge at DHL Germany.

text.p: DHL Worldwide Express GmbH, the Germany division of DHL International, said it did not plan to follow international airlines by introducing a cargo fuel surcharge.

Ulrich Hartmann, DHL managing director Germany, told Reuters in an interview "From a local view, a fuel surcharge does not come into question. For us in DHL Germany, there will be no cargo fuel surcharge."
On the German market, virtually all large airlines have followed the lead of Lufthansa Cargo AG and added a 15 pfennigs additional charge on rates due to the massive rise in fuel costs.
The charge is being passed on fully by freight forwarders to air cargo shippers, industry sources said
Hartmann said: "Our service comes not only from transport. A surcharge is more for point to point traffic where fuel comes to a high proportion (of costs)."
Within DHL, each country was free to decide its own policy since it was autonomous on pricing matters and Hartmann said he could not comment on what DHL was doing in other countries.
